result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon Larry Walker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leon Larry Walker not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Leon Larry Walker. Prosecuting Attorney Claire Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting a Dauber Motion. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 11-28-22 at 8:30 am.  Case is scheduled for a Daubert Motion on 11-23-22 at 2:00 pm in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion In Limine and Request for Trial Procedures, filed.
Defendant's Request for Jury Instructions, filed.
State's Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence at Trial, filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Leon Larry Walker not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Leon Larry Walker.  Prosecuting Attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense enters speedy trial demand.  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 10-12-22 at 1:30 pm  for final pretrial and 11-28-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leon Larry Walker in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Leon Larry Walker in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Leon Larry Walker appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #20CF072. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer W. Mauch. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10
Defendant Leon Larry Walker not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a prelimnary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Leon Larry Walker not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests this matter be set in the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Court ordered no contact with ANK 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Leon Larry Walker in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Leon Larry Walker in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leon Larry Walker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 2.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
